meanings.definition: To burn more intensely or longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: The bonfire outburns the small campfire.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire outburns the controlled burn.
meanings.sent3: The candle outburns the patience of the curious cat.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music outburns all other interests.
meanings.sent5: The sun outburns all the stars in the sky.

meanings.sent1: The volcano outburns any other natural source of heat.
meanings.sent2: The furnace outburns the fireplace in warmth.
meanings.sent3: The spicy chili outburns the taste buds of the unsuspecting eater.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outburns any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's breath outburns all in its path.

meanings.sent1: The raging inferno outburns all other fires in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The blazing sun outburns the flickering candle.
meanings.sent3: The competition outburns the other teams in the tournament.
meanings.sent4: His anger outburns his usual calm demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The rocket's flames outburns the earth's atmosphere.
